name: Hotel Saint Christophe

reviews.text: This hotel is essentially average. Given the multitude of choices in Paris, it's hard to go out and recommend it, but on the other hand there are a lot of worse places out there.
reviews.title: OK thanks to location

reviews.text: The big plus is the location, which is essentially next to a Metro stop, as well as close to many shops/restaurants. The proximity to the university helps there. Also, the staff is quite friendly and helpful. There is also a computer, albeit a very slow one, with complimentary internet. Once you get used to the non-QWERTY European keyboard, it can come in handy.
reviews.title: very welcoming and helpful

reviews.text: On the negative side of things, the cleanliness of the rooms isn't exactly top-notch. Not unusual for trash cans to not be cleaned, carpets to not be vacuumed, etc. Never mind personal items being strangely moved at times. Plus, the rooms can have a musty smell. Also, the rooms are very small (Tokyo small) but maybe not that unusual for Paris. And the lack of free wifi internet is becoming more of an issue now that so many hotels include it in their rate.
reviews.title: St. Christophe has fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a side note, the breakfast should be avoided simply b/c it's not worth the cost. You can go to one of the many bakeries in the area and get much more for less than half the price.
reviews.title: Average 3 star hotel in paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I don't think I'd necessarily stay again, but if you perhaps get a great deal, then it might be worth trying this hotel out...
reviews.title: Nice Stay @ the Hotel Saint Christophe

likes.disliked: — small room (but it is typical of 3 star Paris hotels)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just had 3 nights at the St Christpohe and loved it. This is our 3rd trip to Paris and this hotel and location was the best so far. Very close to place monge metro, market and shops. Walk to saint germaine, pantheon. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The room were ok size for Paris, a little dated but clean and a good bathroom. My only concern was that the rooms were a little hot - they do provide a fan though. When we were there it was nice weather but not all that hot, so I am not sure if we would have enjoyed our stay so much if it had have been over 25 degrees. Apart from that though it is a great hotel and you will struggle to find better value in Paris. We will be back!
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: Our party of three stayed here for two nights in June, and were very pleased. The location is good, within three blocks of Rue Mouffetard with many restaurants specializing in raclettes and fondues. We highly recommend the reasonably priced and charming Restaurant Assiette aux Fromages, which has a garden patio in the back. The hotel was also a 10-minute walk to Rue St. Michel and the Latin Quarter with its numerous cafes, and 15 minutes to Notre Dame.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, especially finding us a private shutter service when we learned of a possible strike that could have prevented us from getting to the airport in time the next morning. It was a treat to have free internet access in the lobby. Our room was fine, with no problems. My mother's room next door to us, with extra windows and a newer bathroom, was very nice.
reviews.title: Very Good Value in Paris

likes.liked: — Nice employees, clean and comfortable rooms
likes.disliked: — world's smallest elevator, but at least they had one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The value was excellent and we would not hesitate to recommend Saint Christophe to others.
reviews.title: Liked this hotel very much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am always apprehensive when we book a place we haven't visited before in big cities like Paris or London. We've had some hits and misses. I'm happy to say that Hotel St. Christophe was a good find.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.disliked: — Breakfast a bit expensive, not included in room price

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. It's pretty much as advertised. It is a middle of the road 3 star hotel with decent off season rates. Close to Metro stops and a short walk to Ile de la Cite. It is generally quiet with minimal street noise. The walls are a bit thin so you could hear other couples "activities".
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in November of last year for a girls weekend with three other friends.I found this hotel to have every thing we could want. Rooms were very clean, a little small but adequate for our stay. We faced the back of the hotel and it could be a little noisy at night. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Location of hotel was also good and within walking distance of Metro. Also hotel was very near a square which had cafes, bars and restaurants. Area felt very safe for us girls on our own. On the whole a good choice of hotel for short stay in Paris. Would definitely recommend this hotel and I would certainly go back myself.
reviews.title: Good Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay. We had a wonderful experience with the Saint Christophe. After reading so many positive reviews on tripadvisor, we booked this hotel for our first visit to Paris. We were not disappointed. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were spotless and modern. The staff was lovely and accommodating. Breakfast was included in our rate and was perfect to hold us over until lunch. The location was ideal, as it is near two metro stops and also convenient to access most of Paris' center on foot. Book a room with confidence. We are particularly fussy travelers and have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. We would gladly stay here again and are confident to recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Fantastic find in an ideal location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here mid-week from 21 to 25 January 2008 and our experience was superb. The hotel is situated close to Notre Dame, in a good area near to some lovely bars, cafes and restaurants. It is ideally located for exploring Paris on foot, but for the less active it is also close to a number of Metro stations. The hotel staff were faultlessly helpful and friendly. The reception staff spoke excellent English which was perfect given my rusty French. We had a room on the fifth floor which was cosy but very comfortable and warm. Outside street noise was not a problem. Most importantly, the room, bathroom and bed linen were spotlessly clean. However, some travellers may wish to take note that the size of the room and the small lift which serves each of the floors might prove problematic for wheelchairs. The hotel facilities included a small breakfast room where a decent continental breakfast was served, and an internet room. To be honest, we didn't expect or require much more.
reviews.title: A great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this hotel was a real charm and I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect place

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed for 4 nights. Loveley and clean. Metro nearby and central to all attractions. Rooms on the small side but had all you need, only nitpick tea and coffee making facilities would be nice. Breakfast was great and all the staff spoke better english than my friend and I speak french. Some lovely cafes nearby too. Would recommend to anyone spending a few days in Paris.
reviews.title: A Little Gem
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 nights in room 64, on the sixth floor up under the eaves with a sloping ceiling. Small room, as expected, but lovely and clean. Two big windows opening onto small balconies. Good for catching a nice breeze.

Location was great- walking distance to most major attractions and also close to many public transit options. Nice neighbourhood to wander in. We bought breakfast each morning at a bakery across the street and walked to the Jardin des Plantes to eat sitting on a bench under the Cedar of Lebanon tree.
reviews.title: Dependably a wonderful, reasonably priced place to stay

likes.disliked: — Breakfast could be a little more imaginative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception was wonderful - fluent in English and always friendly and very helpful. Appreciated the free internet usage for quick emails home.
reviews.title: perfectly parisian

likes.liked: — the staff and location and it was very french

reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.text: On short notice we decided to take a trip to Paris over Thanksgiving. I was looking for a place on the right bank, but Hotel Saint Christophe had the right price. Our local travel agent helped book our stay.
reviews.title: Just Perfect!

reviews.text: I had been warned that some 3-star hotels are not what they seem or what we would expect. From the moment of our arrival, we knew we had booked a great hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous little hotel!!! real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived just after the beginning of the train strikes. The front desk staff was wonderful in giving directions, checking our train schedule (for traveling to the Loire Valley later in the week), and helping to arrange a tour to Versailles (since the trains weren't running). I have never seen such attentive staff!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Lovely Staff

reviews.text: The rooms were clean--mine was on the 6th floor, had a balcony, and contrary to other reviews, the room and bathroom were of good size. My sister's was on the first floor, had 2 twin beds (kind of narrow), and had an even bigger room and bathroom. BOTH rooms were quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: Cosy and intimate atmosphere.
Would not recomend!
reviews.text: Breakfast was simple, filling, and the staff were nice--coffee, croissants, rolls, cheese, yogurt, cereal, butter, and jam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a great few days in this wonderful city.Oct 11-16Great weather,great food,and of course a great little hotel.Catherine and moi spent five nights in the St.Christophe and we fully agree with all the positive comments made here.The hotel itself is spotlessly clean as was our room which was on the 5th floor,with a lovely view over side streets.The staff are friendly and helpful,and really made us feel welcome.
reviews.title: Allez le Blue! ! !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of tips to help you on your visit:
reviews.title: Cramped Christophe
A Stellar Small Hotel!
reviews.text: We arrived from Dublin in CGD at 4 pm.We decided to be adventurous and take the RER to Chatalet then line 7 to Pl. Monge................................a big mistake.Chatalet is a nightmare at rush hour,even moreso with luggage!! Take a taxi its less stressful.About 40mins and 40 euro should see you to your hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 47 Bus is very useful for getting downtown,it drops you back almost at the door of the hotel.Bon Voyage, we will return to the St. Christophe.
reviews.title: Great Place!!

reviews.text: We stayed for four nights at the Hotel Saint Christophe at the end of September. Very close to Place Monge with its thrice weekly market and metro stop, the Saint Christophe is decidedly convenient for the Latin Quarter and central Paris. Our room was located in the front of the hotel, and with the windows open, the street noise was almost unbearable. However, with the windows closed (not an option all times of year), it was relatively quiet. The bed was extremely small, though, making it difficult for two normal sized adults to sleep comfortably. There is some storage space, but the configuration made it difficult to access. The bathroom was clean and functional, but limited space made it challenging to access toiletries for two people. Shower gel and shampoo were provided in tiny tear packages, which we found insufficient for lathering up; bring your own. The breakfast room downstairs is mundane compared to many hotels of this sort, and the breakfast (included in our rate) even more so. While we're used to small continental breakfasts, good bread or croissants make them enjoyable. The service was generally gracious and inviting. We had one small problem with housekeeping leaving only one bath towel, met with the classic French "Impossible!" when we informed the front desk, but then rapidly resolved. All in all, we found this a solid property but nothing special.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We had a room on the fifth floor which was very quiet which was what we wanted. The room itself was small and compact but spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: good value hotel in a good location

description: Cozy Hotel in 6-story, early 19th-century building situated in the Latin Quarter, 50 meters from Botanical Gardens.
